pli-tv-bi-vb-as1:1.1.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo satta adhikaraṇasamathā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-as1:1.1.eng: “Venerables, these seven principles for the settling of legal issues come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-vb-as1:2.1.eng: For the settling and resolving of legal issues whenever they arise there is:

pli-tv-bi-vb-as2:1.1.eng: Resolution through recollection to be granted;

pli-tv-bi-vb-as3:1.1.eng: Resolution because of past insanity to be granted;

pli-tv-bi-vb-as4:1.1.eng: Acting according to what has been admitted;

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:1.1.eng: Covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:2.1.eng: Venerables, the seven principles for the settling of legal issues have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:2.2.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:2.8.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:3.1.eng: The seven principles for the settling of legal issues are finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:4.2.eng: the eight rules on expulsion have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:4.3.eng: the seventeen rules on suspension have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:4.4.eng: the thirty rules on relinquishment and confession have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:4.5.eng: the one hundred and sixty-six rules on confession have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:4.6.eng: the eight rules on acknowledgment have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:4.7.eng: the rules to be trained in have been recited;

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:4.8.eng: the seven principles for the settling of legal issues have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:4.9.eng: This much has come down and is included in the Monastic Code of the Buddha and comes up for recitation every half-month.

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:4.10.eng: In regard to this everyone should train in unity, in concord, without dispute.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-as7:5.1.eng: The canonical text beginning with offenses entailing confession is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:0.5.eng: The training rule on collections of almsbowls

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:0.6.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo tiṃsa nissaggiyā pācittiyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:0.6.eng: Venerables, these thirty rules on relinquishment and confession come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo bahū patte sannicayaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns from the group of six had collected a large number of almsbowls.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.3.pli: Manussā vihāracārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā passitvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.3.eng: When people walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized those nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo bahū patte sannicayaṃ karissanti, pattavāṇijjaṃ vā bhikkhuniyo karissanti, āmattikāpaṇaṃ vā pasāressantī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.4.eng: “How can the nuns collect a large number of bowls? Will they start up as bowl merchants or set up a bowl shop?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.6.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized those nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six collect bowls?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo pattasannicayaṃ karontī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns from the group of six do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo pattasannicayaṃ karissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.11.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six collect bowls?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.14.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī pattasannicayaṃ kareyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun collects almsbowls, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.6.eng: there are two kinds of bowls: the iron bowl and the ceramic bowl.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.7.pli: Tayo pattassa vaṇṇā— ukkaṭṭho patto, majjhimo patto, omako patto.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.7.eng: And there are three sizes of bowls: the large bowl, the medium bowl, and the small bowl.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.9.pli: aḍḍhāḷhakodanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.9.eng: it takes half an āḷhaka measure of boiled rice, a fourth part of fresh food, and a suitable amount of curry.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.11.pli: nāḷikodanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.11.eng: it takes a nāḷika measure of boiled rice, a fourth part of fresh food, and a suitable amount of curry.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.13.pli: patthodanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.13.eng: it takes a pattha measure of boiled rice, a fourth part of fresh food, and a suitable amount of curry.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.14.eng: Anything larger than this is not a bowl, nor anything smaller.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.16.eng: almsbowls that have neither been determined nor assigned to another.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.16.comm: For an explanation of the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.19.pli: Nissajjitabbo saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā ekabhikkhuniyā vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.19.eng: The bowl should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.20.eng: “And, monks, it should relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.21.pli: Tāya bhikkhuniyā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.21.eng: After approaching the Sangha, that nun should arrange her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.22.pli: “ayaṃ me, ayye, patto rattātikkanto nissaggiyo, imāhaṃ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.22.eng: ‘Venerables, this almsbowl, which I have kept for more than one day, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.23.eng: After relinquishing it, she is to confess the offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.24.eng: The confession should be received by a competent and capable nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.25.eng: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.26.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.27.pli: Ayaṃ patto itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā nissaggiyo saṅghassa nissaṭṭho.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.27.eng: This almsbowl, which was to be relinquished by the nun so-and-so, has been relinquished to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.28.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ pattaṃ itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā dadeyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.28.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give this bowl back to nun so-and-so.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.29.pli: Tāya bhikkhuniyā sambahulā bhikkhuniyo upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.29.eng: Or: after approaching several nuns, that nun should arrange her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.30.pli: “ayaṃ me, ayyāyo, patto rattātikkanto nissaggiyo, imāhaṃ ayyānaṃ nissajjāmī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.30.eng: ‘Venerables, this almsbowl, which I have kept for more than one day, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to you.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.31.eng: After relinquishing it, she is to confess the offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.32.eng: The confession should be received by a competent and capable nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.33.eng: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.34.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask you to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.35.pli: Ayaṃ patto itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā nissaggiyo ayyānaṃ nissaṭṭho.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.35.eng: This almsbowl, which was to be relinquished by the nun so-and-so, has been relinquished to you.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.36.pli: Yadi ayyānaṃ pattakallaṃ, ayyāyo, imaṃ pattaṃ itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā dadeyyun”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.36.eng: If the Venerables are ready, you should give this bowl back to nun so-and-so.’

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.37.pli: Tāya bhikkhuniyā ekaṃ bhikkhuniṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.37.eng: Or: after approaching a single nun, that nun should arrange her upper robe over one shoulder, squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.38.eng: ‘This almsbowl, which I have kept for more than one day, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.40.eng: After relinquishing it, she is to confess the offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.41.eng: The confession should be received by that nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.42.eng: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.43.eng: ‘I give this almsbowl back to you.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.1.eng: If it is more than one day and she perceives it as more, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.2.eng: If it is more than one day, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.3.eng: If it is more than one day, but she perceives it as less, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.4.eng: If it has not been determined, but she perceives that it has, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.5.eng: If it has not been assigned to another, but she perceives that it has, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.6.eng: If it has not been given away, but she perceives that it has, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.7.eng: If it has not been not lost, but she perceives that it has …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.8.eng: If it has not been destroyed, but she perceives that it has …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.9.eng: If it has not been broken, but she perceives that it has …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.10.eng: If it has not been stolen, but she perceives that it has, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.11.pli: Nissaggiyaṃ pattaṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.11.eng: If she uses an almsbowl that should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.12.eng: If it is less than one day, but she perceives it as more, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.13.eng: If it is less than one day, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.14.eng: If it is less than one day and she perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.3.2.pli: antoaruṇe adhiṭṭheti, vikappeti, vissajjeti, nassati, vinassati, bhijjati, acchinditvā gaṇhanti, vissāsaṃ gaṇhanti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.3.2.eng: if, before dawn, it has been determined, assigned to another, given away, lost, destroyed, broken, stolen, or taken on trust;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.3.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo nissaṭṭhapattaṃ na denti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:3.1.eng: Soon afterwards the nuns from the group of six did not give back a relinquished bowl.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:3.3.eng: “Monks, a relinquished almsbowl should be given back.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:3.4.eng: If a nun doesn’t give it back, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:3.5.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:0.5.eng: The training rule on exchanging what belongs to an individual

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī bahussutā hoti bhāṇikā visāradā paṭṭā dhammiṃ kathaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā pariveṇaṃ undriyati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.4.eng: Just then the yard of Thullanandā’s dwelling was deteriorating.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.7.eng: and she replied, “I have neither donor, nor worker.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.8.pli: Atha kho te manussā thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā pariveṇatthāya chandakaṃ saṅgharitvā thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā parikkhāraṃ adaṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.8.eng: Then, after collecting voluntary contributions for the yard of Thullanandā’s dwelling, the people gave the collected requisites to Thullanandā.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.9.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī tena ca parikkhārena sayampi yācitvā bhesajjaṃ cetāpetvā paribhuñji.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.9.eng: But even though she had asked for them, Thullanandā exchanged those requisites for tonics, which she then used.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.10.eng: When the people found out about this, they complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena puggalikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.11.eng: “When personal requisites are designated for a specific purpose and were asked for, how could the nun Thullanandā exchange them for something else?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena puggalikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.12.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena puggalikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.15.eng: “When personal requisites are designated for a specific purpose and were asked for, how could the nun Thullanandā exchange them for something else?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.17.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.17.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.18.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena puggalikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.18.1.eng: ‘When a personal requisite is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.4.eng: The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.5.eng: A requisite is designated for a specific purpose:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.6.eng: it was given for a specific purpose.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.8.pli: ekāya bhikkhuniyā, na saṅghassa, na gaṇassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.8.eng: belonging to an individual nun, not to the Sangha, not to a group.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.10.eng: that she herself had asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.12.pli: yaṃatthāya dinnaṃ taṃ ṭhapetvā aññaṃ cetāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.12.eng: if, apart from the purpose for which it was given, she exchanges it for something else, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.13.eng: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.14.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā ekabhikkhuniyā vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.14.eng: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.15.eng: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.16.eng: (To be expanded as in Bi Np 1:2.1.21–Bi Np 1:2.1.43, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.17.pli: “idaṃ me, ayye, aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena puggalikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ, imāhaṃ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.17.eng: ‘Venerables, this thing, which I got in exchange for a personal requisite that was designated for a specific purpose and had been asked for, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.21.1.pli: Aññadatthike aññadatthikasaññā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.21.1.eng: If it is for a specific purpose and she perceives that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.22.pli: Aññadatthike vematikā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.22.eng: If it is for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.23.pli: Aññadatthike anaññadatthikasaññā aññaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.23.eng: If it is for a specific purpose, but she does not perceive that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.24.eng: When she receives in return what had been relinquished, it is to be used in accordance with the intention of the donors.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.24.comm: Vmv 2.740: nissaṭṭhaṁ paṭilabhitvāpi yaṁ uddissa dāyakehi dinnaṁ, tattheva dātabbaṁ. Tenāha “yathādāneyeva upanetabba”nti, “Having obtained what was relinquished, it is to be given in accordance with the designation of the donors. Yathādāneyeva upanetabbaṁ is said in regard to this.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.25.eng: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she perceives that it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.26.eng: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.27.eng: If it is not for a specific purpose, and she does not perceive that it is, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.29.comm: This seems to mean that if there is a remainder after the article has been used as intended, then this may be exchanged for something other than what was specified. Sp 2.762: Sesakaṁ upanetīti yadatthāya dinno, taṁ cetāpetvā avasesaṁ aññassatthāya upaneti, “She uses the remainder means: after exchanging it for the purpose for which it was given, she uses the remainder for another purpose.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.30.eng: if she uses it after getting permission from the owners;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.30.comm: That is, if she makes use of it in another way than what was intended by the owners. Sp 2.762: Sāmike apaloketvāti “tumhehi cīvaratthāya dinno, amhākañca cīvaraṁ atthi, telādīhi pana attho”ti evaṁ āpucchitvā upaneti, “After getting permission from the owners means: she makes use of it after asking, ‘It was given by you for the purpose of robes, but we have robes and we need oil, etc.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.33.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.34.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:0.5.eng: The training rule on heavy cloaks

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī bahussutā hoti bhāṇikā visāradā paṭṭā dhammiṃ kathaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.3.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo sītakāle mahagghaṃ kambalaṃ pārupitvā yena thullanandā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.3.eng: On one occasion when the weather was cold, King Pasenadi of Kosala put on an expensive woolen cloak and went to Thullanandā. He bowed and sat down.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ thullanandā bhikkhunī dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.4.eng: And Thullanandā instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.5.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.7.pli: “Sace me tvaṃ, mahārāja, dātukāmosi, imaṃ kambalaṃ dehī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.7.eng: “Great king, if you wish to give me something, then give me this woolen cloak.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.8.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā kambalaṃ datvā uṭṭhāyāsanā thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.8.eng: The king gave her his cloak. He then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated her with his right side toward her, and left.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.10.eng: “These nuns have great desires; they are not content.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.11.eng: How can they ask the king for his woolen cloak?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.12.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.12.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.13.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.13.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.14.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā rājānaṃ kambalaṃ viññāpessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.14.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā ask the king for his woolen cloak?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.15.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī rājānaṃ kambalaṃ viññāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.15.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā asked for this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.18.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī rājānaṃ kambalaṃ viññāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.18.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā ask the king for his woolen cloak?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.20.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.20.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.21.1.pli: “Garupāvuraṇaṃ pana bhikkhuniyā cetāpentiyā catukkaṃsaparamaṃ cetāpetabbaṃ. Tato ce uttari cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:1.21.1.eng: ‘If a nun carries out an exchange to get a heavy cloak, it is to be worth at most four kaṁsa coins. If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.1.comm: The pāvuraṇa was a garment for lay people, used in much the same way as the upper robe was used by monastics. When you put it on, you pārupati it, which is what you do with an upper robe. This again points to the small difference between monastic robes and lay people’s clothes at the time of the Buddha. This is presumably why Thullanandā could use such a cloak for herself, thereby effectively transforming it into a robe.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.2.eng: whatever cloak is used in cold weather.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.3.eng: Carries out an exchange to get:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.5.eng: It is to be worth at most four kaṁsa coins:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.6.eng: it may be worth sixteen kahāpaṇa coins.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.7.eng: If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.8.eng: if she asks for one worth more than that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.9.eng: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.10.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā ekabhikkhuniyā vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.10.eng: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.11.eng: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.12.eng: (To be expanded as in Bi Np 1:2.1.21–Bi Np 1:2.1.43, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.13.pli: “idaṃ me, ayye, garupāvuraṇaṃ atirekacatukkaṃsaparamaṃ cetāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ, imāhaṃ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.1.13.eng: ‘Venerables, this heavy cloak worth more than four kaṁsa coins, which I got in exchange, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.1.eng: If it is worth more than four kaṁsa coins, and she perceives it as such, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.2.eng: If it is worth more than four kaṁsa coins, but she is unsure of it, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.3.eng: If it is worth more than four kaṁsa coins, but she perceives it as being worth less, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.4.eng: If it is worth less than four kaṁsa coins, but she perceives it as being worth more, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.5.eng: If it is worth less than four kaṁsa coins, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.2.6.eng: If it is worth less than four kaṁsa coins, and she perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.2.eng: if she carries out an exchange for one worth at most four kaṁsa coins;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.3.eng: if she carries out an exchange for one worth less than four kaṁsa coins;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.5.eng: if it is from those who have given an invitation;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.6.eng: if it is for the benefit of someone else;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.7.eng: if it is by means of her own property;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.8.eng: if she gets one in exchange that has little value from someone who wants to exchange one of great value;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.10.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np11:2.3.11.eng: The eleventh training rule is finished.
